first_phrase: This text is an excerpt from a medical report written by a physician, who has been providing care for a patient named Mr. Arnaud since 1877. The passage describes the physician's attempt to diagnose and treat Mr. Arnaud's medical condition, which involved severe pain and discomfort in his abdominal area. The physician initially suspected hemorrhoids but later discovered that Mr. Arnaud had multiple abscesses in his intestines. The physician turned to a magnetic subject named Calixte to help him diagnose and treat Mr. Arnaud further. The last 200 tokens discuss the societal and scientific attitudes toward magnétisme and hypnotisme. The author argues that these practices have been consistently denounced by some sectors of science, without adequate evidence, to the detriment of the patients that could benefit from it.
